  • Method Details

    • toOptional

      @NotNull public @NotNull Optional<T> toOptional()
      Description copied from interface: Result
      Turns the Result into an Optional. If the Result is Result.Ok, the Optional will contain the value. If the Result is Result.Fail, the Optional will be empty.
      Specified by:
      toOptional in interface Result<T>
      Returns:
      The value, if present, in an Optional

    • error

      @NotNull public @NotNull Optional<Exception> error()
      Description copied from interface: Result
      If this Result is Result.Fail, returns the exception. Otherwise, returns an empty Optional
      Specified by:
      error in interface Result<T>
      Returns:
      The exception, if present, in an Optional

    • orElse

      @NotNull public @NotNull Result<T> orElse(Supplier<Result<T>> supplier)
      Description copied from interface: Result
      Applies an "or" operation to the Result. If either Result is Result.Ok, Result.Ok is returned, prioritizing the left Result. Otherwise, the exception from the left Result is returned in a Result.Fail
      Specified by:
      orElse in interface Result<T>
      Parameters:
      supplier - A supplier for the right Result
      Returns:
      The result of the "or" operation

    • flatMap

      @NotNull public <R> @NotNull Result<R> flatMap(SafeFunction<T,Result<R>> function)
      Description copied from interface: Result
      Applies a function to the Result, passing through the exception if the Result is Result.Fail This allows the composition of Result-ful functions, making Result a monad (technically not a lawful monad because the function can throw exceptions)

      If the left Result is Result.Ok, the function is applied to the value and the result is returned. If the function throws an exception, it is caught and returned in a Result.Fail Otherwise, the exception from the left Result is returned in a Result.Fail

      Specified by:
      flatMap in interface Result<T>
      Type Parameters:
      R - The type of the result of the function
      Parameters:
      function - The function to apply
      Returns:
      A new Result containing the result of the function or the exception from this Result
      See Also:
      • for a version that cannot throw checked exceptions

    • map

      @NotNull public <R> @NotNull Result<R> map(SafeFunction<T,R> function)
      Description copied from interface: Result
      Applies a given function to the Result, threading through the exception if the Result is Result.Fail. This would make Result a functor if it were not for the fact that the function can throw an exception.
      • If the Result is Result.Ok, the function is applied to the value and the result is returned in a new Result.Ok.
      • If the function throws an exception, the exception is returned in a new Result.Fail.
      • If the Result is Result.Fail, the exception is returned in a new Result.Fail.
      Specified by:
      map in interface Result<T>
      Type Parameters:
      R - The type of the result of the function
      Parameters:
      function - The function to apply
      Returns:
      A new Result containing the result of the function or the exception from this Result

    • getOrThrow

      @NotNull public T getOrThrow()
      Description copied from interface: Result
      Returns the value if the Result is Result.Ok, otherwise throws the exception
      Specified by:
      getOrThrow in interface Result<T>
      Returns:
      The value

    • handle

      public <R> R handle(Function<T,R> successHandler, Function<Exception,R> exceptionHandler)
      Description copied from interface: Result
      Handle the 2 cases of the Result separately with 2 functions If the Result is Result.Ok, the first function is applied to the value. If the Result is Result.Fail, the second function is applied to the exception.
      Specified by:
      handle in interface Result<T>
      Type Parameters:
      R - The type of the result of the function
      Parameters:
      successHandler - The function to apply if the Result is Result.Ok
      exceptionHandler - The function to apply if the Result is Result.Fail
      Returns:
      The result of the function applied to the value or exception

    • recover

      public T recover(Function<Exception,T> exceptionHandler)
      Description copied from interface: Result
      Handles the exception case of the Result with a function. If the Result is Result.Ok, the value is returned. If the Result is Result.Fail, the function is applied to the exception.
      Specified by:
      recover in interface Result<T>
      Parameters:
      exceptionHandler - The function to apply if the Result is Result.Fail
      Returns:
      The value or the result of the function applied to the exception

      public boolean isSuccess()
      Specified by:
      isSuccess in interface Result<T>
      Returns:
      If the Result is Result.Ok. This should be equivalent to !isFail()

      public boolean isFailure()
      Specified by:
      isFailure in interface Result<T>
      Returns:
      If the Result is Result.Fail. This should be equivalent to !isSuccess()
